your ISO 20000 Foundation

32
00:01:55.228 --> 00:02:00.570
exam through their website at a time and
a date to suit yourself.

33
00:02:00.570 --> 00:02:05.550
And then you will be given the exam at
that appropriate time in exactly the same

34
00:02:05.550 --> 00:02:08.490
way as you would with your
ITIL Foundation test.

35
00:02:08.490 --> 00:02:12.617
So as I've said, you get 40 questions,
and you get an hour to complete this.

36
00:02:12.617 --> 00:02:16.050
You've gotta get 26 out
of 40 in order to pass.

37
00:02:16.050 --> 00:02:21.660
Now with every single question,
there is only one right answer.

38
00:02:21.660 --> 00:02:26.260
At the moment, on the peoplecert website,
there is a sample paper, and

39
00:02:26.260 --> 00:02:32.490
that sample paper is 10 questions in
length, just to give you an idea for

40
00:02:32.490 --> 00:02:38.130
what is expected in your
ISO 20000 Foundation test.

41
00:02:38.130 --> 00:02:42.902
Now obviously,
this test is designed to test that you

42
00:02:42.902 --> 00:02:48.110
understand what is required
in the ISO 20000 audit.

43
00:02:48.110 --> 00:02:52.241
Now I know that there's only 10 questions
on there, and we're going to go through

44
00:02:52.241 --> 00:02:55.070
these 10 questions now, so
that is your sample paper.

45
00:02:55.070 --> 00:03:00.950
However, you do have the option for
downloadable

46
00:03:00.950 --> 00:03:06.420
questions as part of your downloadable
material to do with this particular class.

47
00:03:06.420 --> 00:03:11.310
So, there are additional questions there,
and we'll make those available to you.

48
00:03:11.310 --> 00:03:15.024
But for now, for the actual official
sample paper from peoplecert,

49
00:03:15.024 --> 00:03:16.750
you have 10 questions.

50
00:03:16.750 --> 00:03:18.611
And so yep, we're gonna go over these now.

51
00:03:18.611 --> 00:03:21.702
And in fact,
this is gonna be a pop quiz, and

52
00:03:21.702 --> 00:03:26.734
I'm putting Cherokee on the spot,
even more than I would normally do.

53
00:03:26.734 --> 00:03:27.951
>> [LAUGH] It's gonna go great,
like I told you.

54
00:03:27.951 --> 00:03:30.918
>> Cuz I'm feeling kind
of vindictive today.

55
00:03:30.918 --> 00:03:34.940
>> [LAUGH]
>> It's thundering outside,

56
00:03:34.940 --> 00:03:41.220
we've got a bit of rain, and I'm in one
of those vindictive moods, so watch out.

57
00:03:41.220 --> 00:03:45.336
Somebody did say to me yesterday actually
that they were incredibly scared of me.

58
00:03:45.336 --> 00:03:46.569
>> [LAUGH] It wasn't me either.

59
00:03:46.569 --> 00:03:49.410
[LAUGH]
>> It should have been her.

60
00:03:49.410 --> 00:03:53.070
[LAUGH] All right, let's take a look
at question number 1 then, should we?

61
00:03:53.070 --> 00:03:57.572
Okay, then, what do you reckon then,
question number 1, Cherokee?

62
00:03:57.572 --> 00:04:04.470
ISO 20000-1, so that's part 1,
can be applicable to a service provider,

63
00:04:04.470 --> 00:04:08.920
even if the customers or
supplies have demonstrated conformity.

64
00:04:08.920 --> 00:04:12.870
Or only if the suppliers have
demonstrated conformity.

65
00:04:12.870 --> 00:04:17.633
Or only if the suppliers haven't
demonstrated conformity to ISO 20000.

66
00:04:17.633 --> 00:04:20.522
Or only if its customers have
demonstrated conformity.

67
00:04:22.508 --> 00:04:26.620
>> Okay, so
[LAUGH] it's not about the customers.

68
00:04:26.620 --> 00:04:30.760
But that sounds horrible, but in this
situation, we're really talking, and

69
00:04:30.760 --> 00:04:33.920
it's not really falling
onto the suppliers.

70
00:04:33.920 --> 00:04:36.676
It's not their responsibility to have or
have not.

71
00:04:36.676 --> 00:04:39.730
So I'm gonna go with A for this one, Jo.

72
00:04:39.730 --> 00:04:40.308
>> It is actually A.

73
00:04:40.308 --> 00:04:44.890
It doesn't matter about the customer or
the supplier in this instance.

74
00:04:44.890 --> 00:04:46.840
It's actually about you.

75
00:04:46.840 --> 00:04:50.233
You're the one that's being audited,
not your customers and not your suppliers,

76
00:04:50.233 --> 00:04:50.967
it's about you.

77
00:04:50.967 --> 00:04:54.930
So it doesn't matter what they've done, so
whether they have demonstrated or whether

78
00:04:54.930 --> 00:04:58.529
they haven't demonstrated conformity
to ISO 20000, the onus is on you.

79
00:04:58.529 --> 00:05:01.000
You're the one that's trying
to achieve ISO 20000.

80
00:05:01.000 --> 00:05:04.930
Now, you might not like
the wording on this, tough.

81
00:05:04.930 --> 00:05:08.540
[LAUGH] That's what
I've got to say to you.

82
00:05:08.540 --> 00:05:11.268
This is very typical of
the wording in your test.

83
00:05:11.268 --> 00:05:15.150
So I'm gonna tell you as I
do with every single test,

84
00:05:15.150 --> 00:05:20.810
RTFQ, read the full question.

85
00:05:20.810 --> 00:05:23.090
Be very, very clear on this.

86
00:05:23.090 --> 00:05:24.640
Read the full question.

87
00:05:24.640 --> 00:05:29.610
You have got an hour to do this test,
and you have got, well, it's an hour,

88
00:05:29.610 --> 00:05:31.970
60 minutes, and you've got 40 questions.

89
00:05:31.970 --> 00:05:34.670
That's a minute and a half per question.

90
00:05:34.670 --> 00:05:38.010
Take your time, and
read every single word.

91
00:05:38.010 --> 00:05:41.516
And in this case, it's, well, A.

92
00:05:41.516 --> 00:05:43.020
So what about number 2 then?

93
00:05:43.020 --> 00:05:47.160
In the Plan-Do-Check-Act methodology,
sometimes known as the demon cycle,

94
00:05:47.160 --> 00:05:48.960
it can be applied to all processes.

95
00:05:48.960 --> 00:05:49.827
What about act?

96
00:05:49.827 --> 00:05:51.890
What does act do?

97
00:05:51.890 --> 00:05:54.140
>> Act is where we're
actually doing something.

98
00:05:54.140 --> 00:05:55.980
So let's see what our
options that we've got.

99
00:05:55.980 --> 00:05:59.830
Implement a process, take an action
to improve process performance,

100
00:05:59.830 --> 00:06:04.240
establish objectives and
processes to deliver results.

101
00:06:04.240 --> 00:06:07.740
Okay, so
let me think about this one here then.

102
00:06:09.130 --> 00:06:12.177
Implementing, so
that's a form of acting, right?

103
00:06:12.177 --> 00:06:19.431
Let's see, but taking an action to improve
process performance, hm, I would say,

104
00:06:19.431 --> 00:06:23.198
there's always like [CROSSTALK]
>> There's only ever one answer.
